titles.title: The Single Grain Of Corn (little work)

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}How can that single grain of corn So desolate and so forlorn Lie buried down beneath the ground Where not a sight and not a sound Can even for one moment brief Bring it a vestige of relief{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}And not a single ray of light Is shed upon its sorry plight The darkness is so very dense The lonliness is so intense And there's no other to explain Its strange estate to that lone grain{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Concealed in such a somber spot Can it consent to lie and rot Can it submit to slow decay Can it let life ebb all away Can it lie still and simply wait Till it shall quite disintegrate{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}It can! Hid in its heart there lies A life that utterly defies The grave and low beneath the soil Can wrest from death the richest spoil Do you behold those many grains They're fruit of one seed's grievous pains{/lang-eng}
